status_notes: Case Resolved. Dear Constituent,. The Boston Public Works Department did not issue a street opening permit to Spectra for the pipeline work. The Federal Government issued the permit which allows Spectra to work Monday through Saturday 7am to 7pm. The Boston Public Works Construction Inspection Unit (CIU) contacted Spectra and asked them why they were working Saturday night past 7pm and on Sunday.  They stated they had to do work on their substation on Grove St which is their private property.  They also stated that they tried to mitigate the noise through the use of sound blankets. They worked till around 9pm on Saturday and during the day on Sunday.  They City informed Spectra going forward that if they were going to work on their private property they would notify the CIU 48 hours in advance. In addition, the City may have the noise levels measured to insure the decibel levels do not go above the City ordinance.  They agreed to those terms. They also understood that whenever they would impact a residents driveway during the course of their work, they would notify the residents before the work started explaining why they had to do the work and provide contact information if any issues arise. For any questions or concerns, please contact the number listed below. Sincerely,. Mark Cardarelli. Supervisor of Utility Coordination and Compliance. Boston Public Works Department. 617-635-4951.

description: Second request. Wood Island station. Thank you.

Yes, smoking in the park is prohibited;    however, no one cares. I've called the police dozens of times over the past nine months about dealers carrying and selling large quantities of marijuana at this location in the park. Last time, I even pointed them out to an officer in his SUV a hundred yards away. He told me that marijuana is decriminalized, which is obviously true, but dealing large quantities of it is not. I told him I spoke to Officer Longo about the dealers there and he replied, "Officer Longo can't help you". 

It would be nice if city hall forced the police to clean up this area of the park - from instances this summer concerning dealers getting caught with handguns to people getting stabbed, this area needs law enforcement and has for a long time, considering the many articles that highlight the problems in the Common near Park Street going back years.

311 - why isn't anyone addressing this? You don't even close out the old complaints of drug dealing here.
Pot smoking along Armstrong path in the Common. Isn't smoking in parks prohibited?
